requirements.summary: Create storefront routing + page shells with consistent header/footer navigation and mobile-friendly menu.
acceptanceCriteria: Users can navigate between all listed pages via a consistent header/footer navigation.
Routes are accessible and render non-empty page shells with appropriate titles and basic empty/loading states.
Mobile navigation is usable on small screens (e.g., collapsible menu).

file_operations.description: Create the application router and route layout wiring for: Home, Category listing, Product detail, Cart, Checkout, Wishlist, Orders, Account/Login, Support, Admin, plus /payment-success and /payment-failure for Stripe return handling.
Create a shared layout composing header + footer and an outlet region so all storefront/admin pages share consistent navigation. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create responsive header with desktop links + mobile collapsible navigation, cart shortcut, wishlist shortcut, and account/login entry. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create footer with Support link, WhatsApp link placeholder (configurable number), and basic marketplace footer sections.
Create Home page shell with sections placeholder (hero, offers, featured categories) and data loading states.
Create Category listing page shell that reads category/subcategory from route params/search and shows a product grid area with loading/empty states.
Create Product detail page shell with gallery area, variant selector area, reviews section, and cart/wishlist action area with loading states.
Create Cart page shell for line items, totals, and checkout CTA with empty state.
Create Checkout page shell with shipping/contact form, order summary, and payment method selection UI placeholders.
Create Wishlist page shell listing saved products with remove action placeholders and empty state.
Create Orders page shell for order list and order tracking detail view placeholders with loading/empty states.
Create Account/Login page shell that shows logged-in state, profile summary, and navigation to orders/wishlist/admin (when permitted).
Create Support page shell containing contact form UI and WhatsApp link section.
Create Admin panel layout shell with left navigation for Products, Categories, Orders, Users/Roles, Support inbox, and Stripe setup sections.
Create initial admin dashboard landing page shell with shortcuts to management sections.

requirements.summary: Implement a premium, coherent visual theme (non blue+purple) across the UI using a consistent component styling approach.
acceptanceCriteria: All primary UI elements (buttons, inputs, cards, badges, headings) use a consistent design system.
Pages are responsive and readable on mobile and desktop.
No default blue+purple theme is used unless explicitly required (not required here).

file_operations.description: Define global CSS variables for shadcn-style theming in a warm neutral premium palette (avoid default blue+purple), base typography, and consistent spacing defaults; ensure fast, mobile-friendly styles. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Adjust Tailwind theme extensions (if needed) to support the premium palette and typography scale used throughout the storefront and admin UI.

Create small wrapper components (e.g., PageContainer, SectionTitle, LoadingSkeleton, EmptyState) that compose shadcn/ui primitives without modifying frontend/src/components/ui directly. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Build Home page with hero banners, offers, and featured categories for the six top-level categories.
acceptanceCriteria: Home page renders at least: hero banner area, an offers strip/section, and a featured categories grid for the six categories.
Featured categories link to the relevant category listing page.
Images are optimized and do not block initial render (use appropriate sizing and lazy loading where sensible).

file_operations.description: Implement hero using generated banner image, offers/promo section, and a featured categories grid for the 6 provided categories; wire category tiles to category listing routes and use responsive, fast-loading layout.
Create React Query hooks to fetch categories and products needed by Home (e.g., featured categories) via useActor(), with loading/empty states and safe caching.

requirements.summary: Implement category-wise product listing with category/subcategory navigation plus basic client-side filters/sorting and pagination/incremental loading.
acceptanceCriteria: Selecting a category shows only products in that category (and optionally selected subcategory).
Sorting changes product order without breaking navigation.
Listing supports pagination or incremental loading to avoid rendering extremely large lists at once.

file_operations.description: Implement category + optional subcategory navigation UI, product grid rendering from backend category query, and client-side sorting/filter controls (price sort, in-stock/variant availability where possible) with incremental loading/pagination.

Create reusable product card for listings with image slot, name, price, wishlist toggle affordance placeholder, and navigation to product detail. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create top-level category + subcategory navigation component used on listing pages and optionally header. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create a hook to manage local listing state (sort, filters, pagination/incremental loading) while keeping route params/search in sync.

requirements.summary: Implement product detail UI with gallery, variants, reviews + authenticated review submission, and add-to-cart/add-to-wishlist actions.
acceptanceCriteria: Variant selection updates the selected SKU/variant state and add-to-cart uses the selected variant.
Authenticated users can submit a review; unauthenticated users are prompted to sign in.
Add to cart and add to wishlist persist and reflect in UI state after refresh.

file_operations.description: Implement product detail rendering using product + variant queries, variant selector, image gallery UI, review list and review submission (gated by Internet Identity), and add-to-cart action wired to cart hook; include wishlist toggle affordance (persisting once backend capability exists).
Create React Query hooks for fetching product, variants, and reviews, plus mutation for submitting reviews with authorization error handling.
Create a size/color variant selector component that updates selected variant state and communicates selected variantId upward. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create reviews list + submission form component; gate submission when unauthenticated with a sign-in prompt. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Implement cart with add/update/remove, totals, variant display, and persistence (backend per user + local guest fallback).
acceptanceCriteria: Cart shows line items with product name, chosen variant, unit price, quantity, and subtotal; shows total.
Cart persists across reloads for authenticated users; guest cart persists locally.
Cart actions update UI immediately and remain consistent with backend state after refetch.

file_operations.description: Implement cart state management: when authenticated, use backend cart capabilities via useActor() + React Query; when guest, persist to localStorage and merge/refresh on login; expose add/update/remove and computed totals.
Render cart line items with variant display, quantity controls, remove actions, totals, and proceed-to-checkout CTA; show empty/loading states and keep UI responsive on mobile.
Create reusable cart line-item component with quantity stepper, remove button, variant info, and pricing display. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Implement checkout UI with shipping/contact form, order summary, payment selection, and Stripe redirect flow plus offline/manual options representation.
acceptanceCriteria: Checkout provides payment method choices including Stripe and offline/manual options (UPI, net banking, COD) clearly labeled as manual/offline where applicable.
Stripe checkout completes with an order created/confirmed in backend upon successful payment.
Offline/manual selection creates an order in a 'Payment Pending/Manual Verification' equivalent state for admin handling.

file_operations.description: Implement Stripe checkout session creation using backend createCheckoutSession(), parse JSON to extract url, and redirect via window.location.href; include robust missing-url error handling. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Implement checkout form UI (shipping/contact), order summary from cart hook, payment method selection with Stripe vs offline/manual (UPI/net banking/COD clearly labeled), and trigger Stripe redirect for Stripe method; offline/manual flow remains UI-only until backend order capability is available.

Implement Stripe payment success handler page that reads session identifier from URL, calls backend getStripeSessionStatus() and renders success/error state; then triggers any available backend finalization capability.
Implement Stripe payment failure handler page that renders a clear failure state and provides a link back to cart/checkout.

Implement admin-only Stripe configuration UI using isStripeConfigured() and setStripeConfiguration(); show this panel only when not configured. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire /payment-success and /payment-failure routes to their respective pages and ensure navigation does not use router for Stripe-hosted url redirects.

requirements.summary: Add Internet Identity-based auth UI with account page sections and admin gating based on role checks.
acceptanceCriteria: Unauthenticated users can browse products but must sign in to place orders, view order history, or manage wishlist/reviews.
Admin routes are inaccessible (and backend methods unauthorized) for non-admin principals.
Account page shows logged-in state and provides logout.

file_operations.description: Create login/logout button using the immutable useInternetIdentity hook, clearing React Query cache on logout; use throughout header and account page. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create hooks for fetching caller role (getCallerUserRole/isCallerAdmin) and caller profile (getCallerUserProfile/saveCallerUserProfile) with React Query; handle authorization failures gracefully. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Implement first-login profile setup dialog (name at minimum) based on getCallerUserProfile() returning null; avoid modal flash by respecting actor readiness and fetched state per authorization component guidance. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create an admin-only route guard wrapper that checks isCallerAdmin() and shows an access denied view for non-admins; do not block public browsing routes.
Render authenticated state (profile name) and logout, show user sections links (orders, wishlist) when authenticated, and show Admin link only when isCallerAdmin() is true.
Apply AdminRouteGuard to admin routes and gate wishlist/orders/review submission navigation/CTAs behind authentication while leaving catalog browsing public.

requirements.summary: Add status-based order tracking UI for customers and admin order status management UI shells (frontend-only wiring).
acceptanceCriteria: Customers can view their order list and each order’s current status and items.
Admins can update order status through the admin panel; customers see updates after refresh.
No courier API integration or shipment-ID-based tracking is required.

file_operations.description: Implement customer-facing order list and detail UI shells for statuses (Placed → Packed → Shipped → Delivered, optional Cancelled) with loading/empty states; wire to backend once order capabilities are available.
Create admin orders management page shell showing list/detail and status update controls; wire to backend once order management capabilities are available.
Create a consistent visual badge/stepper for order status display used by both customer and admin views. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire routes for customer orders and admin orders management into the router and admin navigation.

requirements.summary: Implement wishlist UI with authenticated gating and affordances from listing and product detail pages (frontend-only wiring).
acceptanceCriteria: Wishlist page lists saved products with quick remove and navigation to product details.
Wishlist state is persisted per authenticated user.
Wishlist toggle is available on product cards and product detail pages.

file_operations.description: Implement wishlist state manager with authenticated gating and persistence strategy: use backend when capability is available; meanwhile provide local placeholder state for UI development and ensure unauthenticated users are prompted to sign in.
Render wishlist items with quick remove and navigation to product detail; show empty state and require login to view.
Add wishlist toggle affordance on product cards; if unauthenticated, prompt user to sign in instead of toggling.
Add wishlist toggle affordance on product detail page; ensure UI reflects saved state.

requirements.summary: Create admin panel UI for managing catalog, orders, users/roles, and Stripe setup with admin-only gating (frontend-only wiring).
acceptanceCriteria: Admin can create/edit/delete categories and products from the UI and see changes reflected in the storefront.
Admin can view all orders, inspect order details, and update status.
Admin can mark manual/offline payments as verified/paid (as applicable) and proceed order status flow.
Admin can grant/revoke admin role to other principals (or manage an allowlist), with backend enforcement.

file_operations.description: Implement admin products management UI using available backend capabilities (getAllProducts, addProduct); include edit/delete UI shells that remain disabled until backend capabilities exist; ensure admin-only guard is applied. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create admin categories management UI shell (create/edit/delete) and wire to backend once category management capabilities are available; keep admin-only guard. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Implement admin user/role assignment UI using assignCallerUserRole(); include principal input and role selection; admin-only guarded. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create admin support inbox page shell for viewing contact submissions; wire to backend once submission listing capability is available.

Wire admin navigation entries to Products/Categories/Orders/Users/Support/Stripe sections and show Stripe setup prompt when not configured. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Register admin routes and ensure they are wrapped with AdminRouteGuard so non-admin principals cannot access them.

requirements.summary: Add Support page contact form UI and WhatsApp link/button (configurable number) and wire admin review UI shell.
acceptanceCriteria: Contact form includes at least name, email/phone, subject, message; submission is acknowledged with a success state.
Admin can view contact submissions in the admin panel.
WhatsApp button opens wa.me link with the configured phone number and an optional prefilled message.

file_operations.description: Implement support contact form UI (name, email/phone, subject, message) with client-side validation and a success acknowledgement state; wire submission to backend once capability exists.
Add frontend configuration for WhatsApp phone number and optional prefilled message used by Support page and footer.
Create WhatsApp link/button that opens wa.me using configured number and optional message; reuse in Support page and footer. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add WhatsApp button/link in the footer using the shared WhatsAppButton component.
Add UI states for listing and viewing contact submissions, to be populated when backend capability is available.

requirements.summary: Implement baseline SEO and performance: per-page titles/meta where applicable, accessible headings, optimized images, and sensible loading states.
acceptanceCriteria: Each major page sets a meaningful document title (and meta description where implemented).
Images use appropriate formats/sizes and lazy loading for non-critical media.
All pages have loading/empty states for data fetching; no blocking spinner-only screens for extended periods.

file_operations.description: Create a small hook to set document.title and (optionally) meta description from within each page component using useEffect.
Set meaningful page title/meta via usePageMeta and ensure hero/promo images use appropriate sizing and lazy loading where sensible.
Set meaningful page title/meta based on selected category and ensure accessible headings and loading/empty states.
Set meaningful page title/meta based on product and ensure media is not render-blocking and includes loading/empty states for queries.
Set page title/meta and ensure empty/loading states are present.
Set page title/meta and ensure checkout has clear, non-blocking loading and error states.
Set page title/meta and ensure empty/loading states are present.
Set page title/meta and ensure empty/loading states are present.
Set page title/meta and ensure accessible form labels and success state are present.

requirements.summary: Add generated static images under frontend/public/assets/generated and render them in the UI (no backend serving).
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are placed under frontend/public/assets/generated and referenced directly by the frontend.
Home page hero/banner section uses the generated banner images.
Category tiles use the generated category images/icons.

file_operations.description: Add generated static image asset: frontend/public/assets/generated/logo.dim_512x512.png.
Add generated static image asset: frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-banner.dim_1920x700.png.
Add generated static image asset: frontend/public/assets/generated/promo-banner.dim_1920x500.png.
Add generated static image asset: frontend/public/assets/generated/cat-clothing.dim_512x512.png.
Add generated static image asset: frontend/public/assets/generated/cat-beauty.dim_512x512.png.
Add generated static image asset: frontend/public/assets/generated/cat-wellness.dim_512x512.png.
Add generated static image asset: frontend/public/assets/generated/cat-fragrance.dim_512x512.png.
Add generated static image asset: frontend/public/assets/generated/cat-jewellery.dim_512x512.png.
Add generated static image asset: frontend/public/assets/generated/cat-lifestyle.dim_512x512.png.
Create a small brand component to render the generated logo asset in header/footer. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Reference frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-banner.dim_1920x700.png and frontend/public/assets/generated/promo-banner.dim_1920x500.png in hero/promo sections with responsive sizing and lazy loading where sensible.

Create featured categories grid component that maps the 6 categories to the generated tile images (cat-*.dim_512x512.png) and links to category listing routes. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Use FeaturedCategories to render category tiles with generated images: frontend/public/assets/generated/cat-clothing.dim_512x512.png, cat-beauty.dim_512x512.png, cat-wellness.dim_512x512.png, cat-fragrance.dim_512x512.png, cat-jewellery.dim_512x512.png, cat-lifestyle.dim_512x512.png.
